flounder.devices

Class DeviceDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.devices.DeviceDisplay

  • public class DeviceDisplay
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the creation, updating and destruction of the display, as well as timing and frame times.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected DeviceDisplay(int displayWidth, int displayHeight, java.lang.String displayTitle, boolean displayVSync, boolean antialiasing, int samples, boolean displayFullscreen)
      Creates a new GLFW window.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeviceDisplay

        protected DeviceDisplay(int displayWidth,
                        int displayHeight,
                        java.lang.String displayTitle,
                        boolean displayVSync,
                        boolean antialiasing,
                        int samples,
                        boolean displayFullscreen)
        Creates a new GLFW window.
        Parameters:
        displayWidth - The window width in pixels.
        displayHeight - The window height in pixels.
        displayTitle - The window title.
        displayVSync - If the window will use vSync..
        antialiasing - If OpenGL will use altialiasing.
        samples - How many MFAA samples should be done before swapping buffers. Zero disables multisampling. GLFW_DONT_CARE means no preference.
        displayFullscreen - If the window will start fullscreen.

    • Method Detail

      • pollEvents

        protected void pollEvents()
        Polls for window events. The key callback will only be invoked during this call.

      • swapBuffers

        protected void swapBuffers()
        Updates the display image by swaping the colour buffers.

      • screenshot

        public void screenshot()
        Takes a screenshot of the current image of the display and saves it into the screenshots folder a png image.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns:
        The width of the display in pixels.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns:
        The height of the display in pixels.

      • setCursorHidden

        public void setCursorHidden(boolean hidden)

      • getWindow

        public long getWindow()
        Returns:
        The current GLFW window.

      • getAspectRatio

        public float getAspectRatio()
        Returns:
        The aspect ratio between the displays width and height.

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns:
        The window's title.

      • isEnableVSync

        public boolean isEnableVSync()
        Returns:
        If the display is using vSync.

      • setEnableVSync

        public void setEnableVSync(boolean vsyncEnabled)
        Set the display to use VSync or not.
        Parameters:
        vsyncEnabled - Weather or not to use vSync.

      • isAntialiasing

        public boolean isAntialiasing()
        Returns:
        If the display requests antialiased images.

      • setAntialiasing

        public void setAntialiasing(boolean antialiasing)
        Requests the display to antialias.
        Parameters:
        antialiasing - If the display should antialias.

      • getSamples

        public int getSamples()
        Returns:
        How many MFAA samples should be done before swapping buffers.

      • setSamples

        public void setSamples(int samples)
        How many MFAA samples should be done before swapping buffers. Zero disables multisampling. GLFW_DONT_CARE means no preference.
        Parameters:
        samples - The amount of MFSS samples to be used in the window.

      • isFullscreen

        public boolean isFullscreen()
        Returns:
        Weather the display is fullscreen or not.

      • setFullscreen

        public void setFullscreen(boolean fullscreen)
        Set the display to fullscreen or windowed.
        Parameters:
        fullscreen - Weather or not to be fullscreen.

      • getXPos

        public int getXPos()
        Returns:
        The x posiiton of the display in pixels.

      • getYPos

        public int getYPos()
        Returns:
        The y posiiton of the display in pixels.

      • isFocused

        public boolean isFocused()
        Returns:
        If the GLFW display is selected.

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Returns:
        If the GLFW display is open or if close has not been requested.

      • requestClose

        public void requestClose()
        Indicates that the game has been requested to close. At the end of the current frame the main game loop will exit.

      • getTime

        public float getTime()
        Returns:
        The current GLFW time time in seconds (by running glfwGetTime() * 1000.0f).

      • dispose

        protected void dispose()
        Closes the GLFW display, do not renderObjects after calling this.
